article.title: World Wide Technology Wins Radio-Frequency Identification Contract
article.author: George I. Seffers
article.text: World Wide Technology, Maryland Heights, Mo., is being awarded a $9,967,138 firm-fixed-price contract for support to the Defense Logistics Agency Radio-Frequency Identification Program upgrade. Naval Surface Warfare Center Crane, Crane, Ind., is the contracting activity (N00164-13-F-0167).
